item.title: Large pothole o/s 92 Rowley Avenue, 16th February
item.description:
Large pothole o/s 92 Rowley Avenue - gets filled with water and if there is not a car parked outside the house, a cyclist will fall off their bike and possible gravel could come up and crack his back window of the car that is parked on his drive - Resident knows that we have had this conversation with lots of people, and is worried that especially elderly people could fall down - can this be looked into asap
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 90, Rowley Avenue, Blendon, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poor road surface, 16th February
item.description:
Poor road surface and pot holes Between nursery avenue and Pelham Road the road surface is terrible as you can see. Each time it rains it gets worse and puts stones up into the road I witnessed a near miss accident this morning due to people trying to avoid the holes and damaging the cars. You all can’t see the holes when it rains as it’s so deep. You keep filling in bits here and there but it needs digging up and the road relaying It’s a busy road and a bus route. Might as well get it fixed during the school holidays!! Two other reports in the last month 11th jan 8667537 14th Feb 8915305

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolwich Road, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light Nuisance Complaint, 16th February
item.description:
The street lamp (number 8) in White Oak Gardens, as indicated on the map, shines into our bedroom (1 Acacia Way) at night so is affecting our sleep. Could a light shield be fitted to stop the light shining into the property. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, White Oak Gardens, Blackfen, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken bins left in flowerbed, 16th February
item.description:
Two large bins, one green and one black, left following council contractors' gardening work last week. (They were cutting back the hedges). I'm guessing someone had already dumped these behind those hedges before the gardening work happened, but can they be collected please?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Edward Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 14th February, Babinondas customers parking illegally, 16th February
item.description:
I know there is nothing that can be done now, but on the night of 14th February 2026 customers of the Babinondas restaurant on Green Lanes were parking blocking junctions and the zebra crossing. As far as I am aware there is no enforcement at night (or at any point), but perhaps the owners of Babinondas could be spoken to about this issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Green Lanes, Palmers Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
